* [*Mixed-Effects Models in S and S-PLUS*](https://link.springer.com/book/10.1007/b98882) thee book for nlme, by Jos√© C. Pinheiro and Douglas M. Bates

* [*Mixed Effects Models and Extensions in Ecology with R*](https://link.springer.com/book/10.1007/978-0-387-87458-6) by Alain F. Zuur, Elena N. Ieno, Neil Walker, Anatoly A. Saveliev, and Graham M. Smith

## Other Resources

* [Easy Stats](https://easystats.github.io/easystats/) a collection of R packages to assist in statistical modelling, with a big focus on linear models

* [Mixed Model CRAN Task View](https://mirror.oit.ncsu.edu/cran/web/views/MixedModels.html) a curated list of R packages relevant to mixed modelling

* [R-SIG-mixed-models](https://stat.ethz.ch/mailman/listinfo/r-sig-mixed-models) mailing list for help and discussion of mixed-model-related questions, course announcements, etc
